messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: panicky mother whose  seven year old isn'treading yet WAS Crud
messages.msgSnippet: They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.  Ben Franklin leschke@shaw.ca ... One of my
messages.messageBody:
"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...
>
> I doubt my friend would relax so long as late teens, though! ack. LOL
> I might not be able to do THAT! (working on it...working on it)

One of my biggest regrets is getting past my comfort level when Lars was 12
and pushing him to work on phonics. Yes, he did end up reading. No, he
doesn't like reading. Maybe he wouldn't have liked it anyway, but
considering how much he loved being read tobefore that time, I doubt it.
The whole exercise just seems to have turned him off. He even stopped
wanting to be read to. So work on it . . . work on it! <g>
Tia
